body:
There are two biological sexes, not two genders. There can be as many genders as you can make up because gender is a social concept. But there are only two biological sexes.

She shouldn't have been suspended. Just been told to get back in front of the kids and let them know that she meant biological sexes and that "genders is make believe so you can make up whatever you want."

body:
The only places in the “academic community” where that flies are non-scientific fields like sociology, where there’s little proof involved.

The language has not evolved. There has been an anti-scientific, almost religious, push by ideologues. “The words are different, so they must be different!” is the most idiotic circular reasoning I’ve ever heard.

This is the most basic mechanism of biological beings. You don’t add another layer to the sex of any other organism. But whoa, all of a sudden, in one specific culture at a very recent period of time, for one specific species, we’ve discovered that this most evolutionarily protected dichotomy is suddenly just a construct and was all along. Certainly not an ideological falsehood, no, it’s just been this way all along and we only just found out about it. Never mind the implications it would have for reproduction, and that such individuals diverging from the male-female dichotomy would have been self-selected out of the gene pool long ago if it were true. How convenient and scientific.

body:
>Too bad they aren't even consistent with their own definition standard. 

They really are, though. I haven't see them change "non-binary gender fluid" for over 15 years. They are consistent with their autistic labels.

>This semantics game is just a bad faith argument to push degeneracy.

I do agree that there is a degeneracy push from these kinds of folks. But being specific in teaching science/sex education to children is important. There's no wiggle room when a science teacher says, "Humans have two biological sexes." There is plenty of wiggle room from a science-based perspective if that same teacher says, "there are only two genders." This has never been true in all of recorded human history as humans have created "third kind" genders as far back as we started recording anything. It's not a modern invention even a tiny bit.

parent.body:
The only places in the “academic community” where that flies are non-scientific fields like sociology, where there’s little proof involved.

The language has not evolved. There has been an anti-scientific, almost religious, push by ideologues. “The words are different, so they must be different!” is the most idiotic circular reasoning I’ve ever heard.

This is the most basic mechanism of biological beings. You don’t add another layer to the sex of any other organism. But whoa, all of a sudden, in one specific culture at a very recent period of time, for one specific species, we’ve discovered that this most evolutionarily protected dichotomy is suddenly just a construct and was all along. Certainly not an ideological falsehood, no, it’s just been this way all along and we only just found out about it. Never mind the implications it would have for reproduction, and that such individuals diverging from the male-female dichotomy would have been self-selected out of the gene pool long ago if it were true. How convenient and scientific.

body:
>All that means it's that some overeducated idiots are wrong. 

This is what you had to do to conclude this:

1. Ignore gender ambiguousness all of human history where almost every single culture has some sort of concept of more than 2 genders.
2. Ignore modern science where we can observe odd gender manifestations in the brain that do not fit into the two biological sex categories. In fact, we are getting so good at this that a neuroscientist can look at a brain scan and tell you what type of person is represented (gender fluid, male, female, etc.). With zero experience with the patient. That's an objective measure and shits all over any thoughts or ideas you and anyone like you can come up with to pretend like there are 2 genders. There are not 2 genders, there are many. There are 2 biological sexes - my original point. And you and all these other idiots keep missing it because you're too stubborn to give up your incorrect and outdated use of the word "gender" because of some sort of infantile marriage to a specific but wrong definition.

>Too bad they aren't even consistent with their own definition standard. 

They really are, though. I haven't see them change "non-binary gender fluid" for over 15 years. They are consistent with their autistic labels.

>This semantics game is just a bad faith argument to push degeneracy.

I do agree that there is a degeneracy push from these kinds of folks. But being specific in teaching science/sex education to children is important. There's no wiggle room when a science teacher says, "Humans have two biological sexes." There is plenty of wiggle room from a science-based perspective if that same teacher says, "there are only two genders." This has never been true in all of recorded human history as humans have created "third kind" genders as far back as we started recording anything. It's not a modern invention even a tiny bit.
